info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CRAIG AND NORTHEASTERN NOWATA COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Edna, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... South Coffeyville... Hollow... Centrailia... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
